title: Valley Of Torment
opening: Your party travels to Ailell, the Valley of Torment, to meet up with allied troops and secure reinforcements. It should have been a safe march...

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: We were just talking about Rhea...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: We have searched for five long years but have not found a trace of her. It is possible that she is sleeping somewhere... Just as you were sleeping all those years.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: That is my current theory, yes.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: Do you think so? I truly hope that is the case.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: We have moved against the Empire with the intent of defeating them, but have not given up hope of recovering Rhea. If she is alive, we will find her. Rhea is like family to us...and to you, as well. Please, lend me your strength...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: The messenger we sent to Daphnel returned with a reply. Please, read it at once.

dialogue.speaker: Judith
dialogue.line: I understand your situation. I will help you with whatever strength I have to spare. But there is a problem. Openly marshaling soldiers within my territory could provoke other members of the Alliance. Therefore, I will secretly gather troops in Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Will your group be able to receive the soldiers in this location? From there, it should be safe to return to the monastery by following the border between the Alliance and the Kingdom.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Ailell is a deep valley located on the border of the Kingdom and the Alliance. People stay far away. There, we can meet without anyone finding out. It is decided. Make plans to meet up with our reinforcements at once.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Some day we will take the Imperial capital. It is odd to think that I will be invading the very city that I once called home. Ah, that is still a ways off. I will prepare for our journey to Ailell.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I never do get used to the sight of blood. It always makes me feel as if I might faint. I suppose I've told you that though, yes? I've no idea how you cope with it. I hope this war ends soon. I dislike being lightheaded because other people are bleeding everywhere. Though the thought of working hard for it does sound like quite a pain...

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I didn't think we'd end up fighting Randolph... He's my uncle. Well, not by blood, so... I guess I can handle it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm still worried about you.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Don't worry about me. I'm ready for anything.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're very resolute.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Don't worry about me. I'm ready for anything.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment? What kind of a name for a place is that? It sounds scary. Do I really have to go with you? Hey, um, here's an idea... Maybe let the recluse stay home and hold the fort!

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Hey, Professor, thanks for your hard work again! Nothing to report today! Was I convincing? Was it like he was standing right in front of you? Some things are the same as they were five years ago, but I guess a lot more has changed...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Since the past, I have learned much of the language of Fódlan. But speaking the Fódlan language still gives me difficulty. I can understand, read, and write with nearly perfection now. But understanding and speaking are...fruits of a different color.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's part of your charm.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have gratitude for you, Professor. I hope that I will have fluency one day.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Everyone has a weak spot.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Yes. I will keep practicing more.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Some in Faerghus believe Dimitri is still alive. My father is one such eccentric. Hmph, they can't accept reality. Dimitri is dead. He's not coming back.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Aw, man... I really do not want to go there.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Pull yourself together.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Professor, have you ever been to Ailell? If you had, you'd know. That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why not?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: We may not be students anymore, but it's still important to read. We might even learn something that's useful for our next battle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Studying is important.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I couldn't agree more! I hope the Officers Academy reopens when the war is over.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Training is important too.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I suppose that may be true. I always try my best at both.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: It's a shame the monastery was ruined, but... At least the books are still intact!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Professor, is it really OK to rely on Judith? I hear there are still quarrels within the Alliance... This generous offer of soldiers and supplies seems a little too good to be true. I mean, it's also really impressive, but I'm just a little worried, I suppose...

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: My family, the Galateas, are an offshoot of the Daphnel family. The family split in half when two brothers quarreled over an inheritance. Despite blood relations, the families lived apart from one another, so the relationship has been distant and somewhat estranged. I'm not so much acquainted with Judith, the head of House Daphnel.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Sharing her food with us for nothing in return? Judith really is a great person! She's more like a goddess than the goddess is!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: She is very much like a goddess.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I never met her, so I don't know for sure, but she must be beautiful and kind.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure about that.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: No? Well, she can be a demon for all I care, so long as she feeds me!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: The Valley of Torment... I'd heard of it, but I never expected to go there. It's exciting! I wonder what the landscape is like.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It sounds dangerous.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: It probably is dangerous, but I still want to get there and see it as soon as I can.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It sounds painful.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Hmm, that is an interesting point... The name does seem to suggest that.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment, lies on the border of three noble territories. The Kingdom's Fraldarius and Galatea families, and the Alliance's Daphnel family. In the Fraldarius lands to the north, the former Kingdom army and new duke's army are fighting.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Valley of Torment... Valley of Torment...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Something wrong?

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I once read a book full of legends surrounding Ailell, but I can't seem to remember...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Are you chanting some sort of curse?

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: N-no... I'm trying to remember the legends surrounding Ailell...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: My big brother told me stories of Judith's bravery. With just one look, she tamed a runaway horse that nobody else had been able to touch. When an Almyran general provoked her, she talked him into a tearful apology. She's spectacular. I wish she'd fight alongside us.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: You're not a teacher anymore, and we're not your students, but everyone still calls you Professor. Is there something you'd rather be called?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Professor is fine.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Guess that's what we're used to, huh? All right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Call me by my name.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Oh? All right, then. I'll call you--ugh. Nope! Sorry, can't do it. Too weird.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Meeting reinforcements in the Valley of Torment seems like an astute decision to me. In that land of oppressive heat, it is unlikely that we will be disturbed. It also means we will contend with those harsh conditions ourselves, however. Best ensure we are well prepared.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: It has been only five years, yet so much has changed. Half of the Kingdom has fallen to the Empire, Skirmishes are rife throughout the Alliance. Despite such tumult, we look upon the same sky, unchanged by the storm happening beneath it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you wish you could return to those days?

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Yes, it would be nice, I suppose. Things were... simpler then. Or so they seemed to be, at the time.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's true--it's just like it was all those years ago.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Indeed. I gazed up at this same sky with Mother and Father. It does not feel so long ago at all. Wait, but how would you know, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: The monastery repairs have made solid progress. Most excellent news. When we first returned here, I was unsure what we were going to do with the ruins of this place... But if we can get the cathedral rebuilt, we'll have it looking just like old times soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Hearing that an old student has died cuts me right to the heart... As this war with the Empire continues, we'll see more of it, Professor. We have a duty to fight alongside our students. We taught them how to fight, after all. Now, let's help them win!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Even though we're getting reinforcements, we should still be prepared for the worst. Never shirk your training, no matter what. To practice, I'm going to chop something up with my sword. Unless you'd like to train together! Care to spar?

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I've heard people talk about the Hero of Daphnel. If the stories of her courage are true, no one will be able to stand against us. In different circumstances, I'd have wanted to try crossing swords with her. Right now, we have to focus on getting those reinforcements. Let's hope nothing goes wrong.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: There are enemy spies around. Remain vigilant. Capture anyone who seems suspicious.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: To kill them?

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: What else would we do with them?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: All right, I will.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I'm glad you understand. I'm counting on you.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Gotta clean out the storerooms, tend the flowers, do the washing, dust the library...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That sounds like a lot of work.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Well, it's my job, ya know? Gotta do your job.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you need any help?

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Nah, this is my job. Lady Rhea herself gave it to me. Even if Lady Rhea's not here right now, I still gotta do my duty.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Like you. You gotta have other stuff you oughta be doing, yeah?

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is everyone setting out on a big campaign? Not exactly? Ah, so you're meeting up with the reinforcements. Well, you can leave guarding this place to me! I'll keep an eye out for anything suspicious!

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: I'm overheated and have changed my mind. I'd like to return to my cozy bed now.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Who knew somewhere so hot existed in Fódlan. I wonder if it's OK to walk everywhere...

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Just use the superior emotional fortitude of nobility. And, well...be very careful.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: It is said that this land was born of the goddess's wrath. There was an immense battle here long ago. To end it, she set the entire valley aflame. Of course, there is no record of this. Some theorize this was done by another and then blamed on the goddess...

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: My head is being defeated by this heat. I think I am seeing visions... There, within the mountains... A shadow...

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: That's just the-- Whoa. I see it too.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: It appears to be a military force...but in a different location than the one we agreed to.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: They are dressed like Kingdom soldiers... They fooled us!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Hold a moment... They are dressed like Kingdom soldiers! Is this an ambush?

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: Damn... I thought we had disposed of all the spies.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: They carry the flag of House Rowe... They've joined the Empire, then. To think they'd travel all this way.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Are you ready to confront them, Professor?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: As am I. We have no reason to believe she was intercepted en route, but we must act quickly. Let us take them down and locate Judith's army!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Yes, we must defeat them quickly and locate Judith's army.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: They have chosen the Valley of Torment for this battle, and so we shall send them to the flames of eternity!

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: The Valley of Torment... Perhaps a good place to finish off my life as a knight. Only if that puny force of children is able to kill me, of course...

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: That lion banner--it seems Gwendal is the one leading the troops of House Rowe. He is an experienced general, renowned throughout Faerghus. Let us hold nothing back.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: This is Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Expect this smoke and fire to assail us at every turn. Touching the flames of torment will get you worse than a scorching. Proceed carefully.

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: The Crest of Flames? Ha! Quite full of themselves, aren't they?

battle.speaker: Ashe
battle.line: Just as I thought--the professor's army. But it's too late to back out now. In Lonato's place, I have to do my duty.

battle.speaker: Kingdom Soldier
battle.line: Here we go! Attack them from both sides!

battle.speaker: Judith
battle.line: Oh, old Gwendal is here. And he doesn't look to be an ally...

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: Oh, the Hero of Daphnel is here! I'll expect more from her than the young ones...

battle.speaker: Defeat Conditions
battle.line: All of your units fall in battle, or Judith is defeated.

battle-talk.speaker: Judith
battle-talk.line: You... No, let's leave the pleasantries for later. First, I want you to take this. It's nothing important, but it may prove useful.

boss.speaker: Ashe
boss.line: I know this is it, but... I don't want to die...

boss.speaker: Ashe
boss.line: You want to spare me? Why? I'll... I'll do it. I'll join your side. Let me fight for you.

boss.speaker: Gwendal
boss.line: Does a whelp like you really expect to kill me? I am Gwendal, the Gray Lion, a knight by the hand of Count Rowe! Do your worst!

boss.speaker: Gwendal
boss.line: Ah, so I have found a place to die... Young ones... I thank you...

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: That was quite a predicament. But now we can see to the objective we had in mind.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: To think we'd get into a scrap here of all places. We're lucky we all made it out alive.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm sorry for involving you in this.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Don't worry about it. In this day and age, it's a miracle I've been unscathed this long.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I see why they call you a hero.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Well, that's ancient history.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: So you're that professor everyone talks about. You're just as Claude described.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Claude?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: He asked me to help you because you seemed trustworthy.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: That professor everyone talks about?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: You used to teach at the Officers Academy five years back, right? I guess you didn't teach Claude, though. He asked me to help you because you seemed trustworthy.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Claude of the Alliance? How did he learn of our plans? We can't underestimate someone like him... There is a reason they call him the Master Tactician. But I suppose we are both fighting against the Empire now. The enemy of our enemy is our ally.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: That's right. I have a letter from him as well.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: It's up to you to decide how to use it.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: That is yours, Professor. Please tell me what it says when you see fit.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: OK, let's wrap up this hand-off of soldiers. Not that I suspect you of anything, but... I must warn you that these are very important soldiers for my territory. Don't treat them like expendable equipment.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Oh. By the way, I have some important information. A witness saw Lady Rhea being dragged off by the Imperial Army after the battle five years ago.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Are you sure your source is reliable?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: One of my own saw it happen. I'm certain.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: It seems we chose wisely when decided to fight against the Empire.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Thank you for the information. We will rescue her at all costs.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Now that we have reinforcements, it is time to advance against the Empire. And yet, we do not have enough troops to face our enemy's main army head-on. We have no choice but to use our small numbers wisely by taking over key locations as we blaze our way to the Imperial capital.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's an easy win.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Do not indulge in being overly optimistic. It would be our ruin.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It will be a fierce fight.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Yes, it will. We must brace ourselves.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: As you know, the Oghma Mountains lie south of Garreg Mach, towards the Empire. In order to enter Empire territory, we must travel around those mountains. There are two possible routes--through the Kingdom to the west, and through the Alliance to the east.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's go west.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: The western half of the Kingdom is under the Empire's control. It may be too dangerous to pass through there. I suggest we take the eastern route, for safety.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's go east.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Yes, that makes sense.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: There are lords in the Alliance who support the Empire, but they are, at least, not completely under their control. Furthermore, you hold a key to the Empire within your grasp.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Claude's letter?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Yes, precisely.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Sword of the Creator?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: My charm?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: This is no time for tomfoolery. I am referring to the letter from Claude.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hey there, Teach. It's been a while, hasn't it? I never dared to imagine you might still be alive. Wonders never cease! I don't know exactly why, but I feel that I can trust you. So I'm going to do just that. To that end, I propose an exchange. You're intending to invade the Empire. That much is clear. And that means your only option is to pass through the east. You'll have to cross the Airmid River, which runs along the border between the Empire and the Alliance. That means you'll need to gain control of the Great Bridge of Myrddin, the one closest to Garreg Mach. It just so happens that my family, House Riegan, is in conflict with House Gloucester right now. It would be easy enough for us to eliminate them, but I would prefer that we settle things without it coming to that. Do you see where I'm going with this? We'll act as a distraction and draw House Gloucester away from there. That will allow you to cross through their territory and take the Great Bridge of Myrddin. After you take the bridge from the Imperial army, House Gloucester won't be able to receive their aid. You'll get to cross Myrddin without any trouble, and I'll be able to maintain stability in the Alliance. Not a bad deal, eh? I hope to hear from you soon. Be well, Teach.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: The Master Tactician, indeed. Somehow he is already aware of our plan. The conditions are not bad... All is he says it is. If we take the Great Bridge of Myrddin, and House Gloucester bows down to House Riegan... The route from the monastery to the Empire will be much safer for our forces.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's do it.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: It seems you are decided. We will send our answer at once.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm suspicious.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I am afraid we have no choice, considering the circumstances...
